hints.content:
When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $476$ is one place to the right of the same digits in the number $4{,}760$.

Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |:-:
$\searrow\goldD4$ | $\searrow\purpleD7$ | $\searrow\blueD6$ | $\cancel0$ 
 | $\goldD4$ | $\purpleD7$ | $\blueD6$ 


Moving each digit of $4{,}760$ to the right means dividing by $10$:

$\goldD4{,}\purpleD7\blueD6\greenD0 \div 10 = \goldD4\purpleD7\blueD6$ so,

$\goldD4\purpleD7\blueD6 = \goldD4{,}\purpleD7\blueD6\greenD0 \div 10$
